title: KSI says he is a ‘different animal’ to first fight and will make Logan Paul ‘give up’ in rematch
text:
KSI has claimed that he is a ‘different animal’ to his first meeting with Logan Paul in 2018.

The two YouTube stars met in the amateur ranks and fought to a majority draw, which has led to a rematch – and it’s now become one of the most highly anticipated bouts of 2019.

Both men have turned professional and are set to face off in front of a sold out Staples Centre in Los Angeles, California.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

KSI is in the thick of the second half of his training camp which is taking place in Las Vegas – and he admitted it’s difficult.

“This camp is tough man,” KSI told the Mayweather Channel.

“But I know it’s going to turn me into a beast to the point where Logan is just going to look into my eyes and say ‘I don’t want any of this’.

“I think he’ll give up, maybe even round one or two after he realises that I’m a different animal to last year.

“I’m training so hard, everything is so solid, my team solid, food is good, it’s even better now.

“Everything else is on point, I’m ready. Born ready.”

On the difficulty of his training camp, KSI admitted it is ‘tough’ but is preparing him for victory.

“That’s the aim of the game, obviously I shout and scream and be in pain but that’s the aim of the game.

“That’s how you get better and improve, mark my words on 9 November you’re going to see a different KSI and Logan won’t be ready for it.”
